text: Conus beatrix is a species of sea snail. It is a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Conidae (the cone snails and their allies).World Register of Marine Species: Conus beatrix Tenorio, Poppe, & Tagaro, 2007 AphiaID: 426396 http://www.marinespecies.org/aphia.php?p=taxdetails&id;=426396 Like all species within the genus Conus, these snails are predatory and poisonous. They are capable of "stinging" humans, so live ones should be handled carefully or not at all. It is feared by most other aquatic snails, because few other species have the ability to sting. ==Distribution== Conus beatrix lives only in the seas of the Philippines.An Illustrated Checklist of Recent Conidae http://www.schnr-specimen-shells.com/ConidaeChecklist.html ==References== ==Other websites== * The Conus Biodiversity website *Cone Shells - Knights of the Sea Category:Gastropods
title: Conus beatrix
